description.narrative: Focusing on improving food security, nutrition and protection for conflict-affected communities in Koch (Unity State), the SSJR 7 project will provide emergency livelihood inputs, strengthen VSLA groups, raise awareness on CP and GBV and provide PSS through Child-Friendly Spaces and Women and Girls Friendly spaces. Nutrition activities include outreach, mobilisation, preventive and curative services to children < 5 and pregnant and lactacting women.

title.narrative: Number of pregnant or lactating women admitted for treatment of Severe or Moderate Acute Malnutrition

comment.narrative: 1181 pregnant and lactating women were admitted to the TSFP program for treatment .

title.narrative: Number of children under 5 admitted for treatment of Severe or Moderate Acute Malnutrition

comment.narrative: 1188 severely and moderately malnourished children were admitted to the nutrition programs of Jahjah, Bang, Jahjah and Petpet for treatment of acute malnutrition.

title.narrative: Number of persons with increased/appropriate information on relevant rights and/or entitlements

comment.narrative: 21755 individuals were reached with GBV/CP awareness raising messaging in the target communities of Jahjah, Petpet, Gap, Koat abd Bang Bomas.

title.narrative: Percentage of budget that went to national and local actors

comment.narrative: 31% ( of the budget went to the national partners (HDC=21%, UNIDOR 10%)

title.narrative: Number of participants showing an increased knowledge on the protection subject in focus

comment.narrative: 40 target individuals benefitted from GBV case management training. The 3-day training involved case workers, social workers, community facilitators/volunteers, mother-to-mother support groups, PMCs, police, local and religious leaders and youth leaders.

title.narrative: Number of children that received support specified to their needs

comment.narrative: 4039 children were reached with recreational activities at the CFSs of Bang, Jaak, Kuachlual and Petpet with recreational, life skills and PSS such as drama, signing and dancing, drawing, storytelling, sports and playing games.

title.narrative: Number of persons who receive an appropriate response

comment.narrative: 5970 individuals were reached with PSS and resiliance programs at the WGFs and CFSs. Due to sporadic cattle raids, women and girls continue to be exposed to the risk of assault and GBV/CP concerns remain. CARE and UNIDOR have been monitoring response services for survivors and PSS and resilience activities.

title.narrative: Number of people screened for under nutrition

comment.narrative: A total of 13802 children and PLW (were screened for malnutrition using the MUAC tap, 7628 were normal (green), 5767 moderately malnourished (yellow) and 207 severely malnourished (red). Those severely or moderately malnourished were referred to OTP and TSFP programmes.

title.narrative: Number of crisis-affected people who are also involved in the design, implementation, monitoring and/or evaluation of the programme

comment.narrative: CARE SS with its national partners continue to strengthen accountability with the established AAP system comprising of the Project Management Committees, the new formed Community Accountability Committee, the AAP Committee. Participation of the beneficiaries in project design, planning, implementation and monitoring and evaluation has been supported.

title.narrative: Number of health facilities where nutrition programmes are implemented

comment.narrative: CARE continues to implement the nutrition programme in Petpet, Jahjah and Bang, offering outpatient therapeutic programme (OTP) and targeted supplementary feeding program (TSFP)

title.narrative: Number of persons reached by the implementation of specific GBV prevention measures

comment.narrative: CARE introduced an new activity "Engage men through accountable practice (EMAP) to prevent violence against women and girls"within the WGFs and CFSs. The EMAP process started with sensitization of community leaders, selection and training of facilitators and training of target groups/communities. 16 EMAP groups have been formed (7 female and 9 male groups).

title.narrative: Number of survivors who receive an appropriate response to GBV

comment.narrative: CARE provided case management to GBV survivors based on a survivor-centered approach. 39 GBV survivors received an appropriate GBV response and case management. These GBV survivors included rape (4), physical assault (23), forced marriage (5) and psychological/emotional abuse (7).

title.narrative: Number of adaptations in the design and/or implementation of the JR, as a result of the input from beneficiaries.

comment.narrative: Through the PMCs, beneficiaries have been participating in the project design, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of key aspects. This includes liaising with Payam authorities for the allocation og land for the Jaak WGF following the flood, participating in the provision of construction materials for the health facility in Jahjah, participation in feasibility studies for seed and tool preferences and the establishment of demo plots and kitchens at WGFs.

title.narrative: Number of people provided with resources to protect and start rebuilding livelihood assets

comment.narrative: Through the PMCs, HDC registered 10800 individuals for the FSL inputs. The FSL inputs (seeds + tools) have been distributed in a timely manner and seeds have been planted. VSLAs have benefitted from strengthening of capacity and some have progressed to IGAs.

title.narrative: Percentage of budget spent on capacity building of national an local actors

comment.narrative: UNIDOR conducted organizational needs assessments using the CAT template and institutional capacity strengthening was identified as the priority need. Based on the needs assessment UNIDOR procured equipment such as furniture, basic playing materials (e.g. footballs) for CFS. Equipment was distributed to 5 locations: Mirmir, Bhang, Kuachlual, Jaak and Jahjah CFS, as well as the Koch office.

title.narrative: Number of national and local actors supported with capacity-building

comment.narrative: UNIDOR conducted trainings on case management and reached 42 individuals (F=25, M= 17; all 18+). Participants were stakeholders and service providers in Mirmir and Koch (kuachlual)
